question: Is this normal to go through some point in life?
question_content: Ok I am 13. And going through puberty btw...A few years ago, I had intense thoughts about dying one day. I was so scared thinking about it...I was so depressed thinking one day I would not be alive. It went away and then about a year later it came back. Same, depressing thoughts just thinking the same things. Then about 2 years later (6 months ago) I had started to experience gay thoughts and the fear of being gay. It was one of the worst things I have ever went through. It's funny because during that period of time, I had wished for the death thoughts to come back. Weird huh? I thought that the death scares were way easier to deal with then the stupid sexual orientation thoughts. Well I am over the sexual orientation stuff sort of. Right around when Steve Jobs died I watched some of his speeches involving death and I began to think about death again. I then went to school the next day and thought nothing of it. Maybe a couple weeks later I had my first religious ed class (I'm Christian). The teacher was talking a lot about God and different things and I thought: Wait a second that doesn't make sense...and I began to question what if there isn't a God?! And I was so scared and I did talk to my mom about it and I did feel better. She had also mentioned she felt this way when she was younger too. Well now I still cannot get the thought off my mind! I feel like I am arguing with myself. I just am confused about religion and where I will end up. I feel depressed and I just want my normal life back, I am only 13 and young why should I be feeling this way about death!?! Can someone please help me straiten this out!
